bug.author: NasGit3
bug.summary: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'packaging' after installing skorch
bug.description:
I recently installed skorch package. I installed it in a conda virtual environment using the installation guidance with conda: <denchmark-code> git clone https://github.com/skorch-dev/skorch.git cd skorch python setup.py install </denchmark-code>
However, when I run it throws me the packaging error:
I followed the solution suggested in this <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/hangtwenty/b9820fe204eebb0cc5b9aba49f3c8b22>page</denchmark-link> , but I still get the error. I have python 3.7.5 installed under this conda environment and I didn't get this error before installing skorch.

comments.comment: Does conda install packaging help? Otherwise, can you install skorch from pip? We had a very recent release, so installing from source gives you almost no additional features.
Thank you for your reply! I used "conda install -c conda-forge skorch" after I posted this issue and it worked. Unfortunately, I didn't get to try your solution.
Okay, great that you found a solution.
